data.title: Feature Request: "Copy Path" from explorer tree should default to forward slashes on Windows
data.body:
As a C++ developer, I am often manually adding paths to the includedPath setting in a c_cpp_properties.json file. (Can't what for better cmake or compile_comands.json support :) )

When developing on Windows, this would be easier if the path string that is created on the clipboard when you do "Copy Path" or ALT+SHIFT+C in the file explorer on the left side used forward slashes (or alternatively double backslashes). Currently it uses good old MS-DOS 2.0 compatible paths with a single backslash, which must be manually edited when pasted into a .json file.

Perhaps there could be a separate copy path kb shortcut, or a setting, that could revert this to backslashes for the rare situation where that is necessary to achieve compatibility with some other application.

VScode version : 1.13.1
Windows 10

data.title: When switching between Javascript editor tabs, "End" key does not perform as expected

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b, 2017-05-04T21:26:50.689Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.4.2|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.4.2|
|auto-close-tag|formulahendry|0.4.3|
|output-colorizer|IBM|0.1.1|
|code-beautifier|michelemelluso|1.7.2|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.2|
|stylelint|shinnn|0.26.0|
|vscode-gulp|tanato|0.0.4|
|bootstrap-3-snippets|wcwhitehead|0.0.9|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.4.1|
|html-css-class-completion|Zignd|1.7.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Place your cursor in a line of Javascript code somewhere in the middle of the line;
2. Use the mouse to click a tab to view another Javascript file, as if you were referencing something;
3. Use the mouse to click back to the original tab;
4. Observe that your cursor is right where you left it, in the middle of a line of text;
5. Press and release the "END" key on your keyboard.

Effect: Instead of going to the end of the line that your cursor is in, which is expected behavior, the cursor jumps to the end of the file instead.

This took forever to document because I thought for the longest time that this was a "fat finger" error on my part, but I am able to reliably reproduce this behavior BOTH with Extensions on AND off.

|ActiveFileInStatusBar|RoscoP|1.0.2|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.8.1|
![vs code terminal scroll bar issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22821555/27989326-0a4af288-642e-11e7-93fc-de89eee47cb0.jpg)

|indenticator|SirTori|0.4.2|

|html-css-class-completion|Zignd|1.7.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  If I run a .py file in the built-in Terminal with shortcut key assigned to "command": "python.execInTerminal"
2. I get the results fine. 
3. I kill the terminal
4. I run the same file again.
5.  I get the results fine. But I can't scroll the results with the mouse or keys, also the scroll bar is not visible. The terminal window is frozen.
6. I have to grab the terminal or the main window and resize it up or down, then the terminal and the scrollbar will be scrollable/visible again. I have this issue since the beginning approx. 5 months.

data.title: VSCode crashes whole env while using ember-cli

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: - VSCode Version: Version 1.13.1 (1.13.1) - OS Version: macOS Sierra Version 10.12.5 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Run ember app with `ember serve` 2. After a while of coding with VSCode, usually Chrome is crashing, everything is slow and frozen with following popup Reproduces without extensions: Yes --- I have this issue for a while, but was never really sure what causes these crashes. However, using any other text editors (atom, sublime) never run into the same problem. I tried to disable, but also delete all extensions and this problem still appears. I'm using now, about 2 or 3 months, atom without any problem, again back to VSCode, same. So I did some research, I've found that code has limited file name and `/tmp` folder can cause this problem , I excluded it with config, same. I tried with some other projects (Node, Angular, React, React Native...) and everything works perfectly. VSCode is my favorite editor and I'm using Ember on daily basis, I would be very grateful if somebody can have a look into this, or even has some opinion what this could be about. Thanks and Regards

data.title: Minimap visually broken after suspending Linux

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:18:03.540Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-83-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|material-icon-theme|PKief|2.0.10|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.12.0|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.6|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a file and make sure the minimap is enabled and usable.
2. Suspend the system from the power menu.
3. Wake the system up and log in.
4. Observe noise.

I've only tested this with Ubuntu 16.04, but I have tested it multiple times. I have not tested it between reboots, but I suspect since you'd have to close and reopen the process that it wouldn't occur.

Changing what the minimap would display in any way I tested (clicking the minimap, scrolling, etc...) reverts the minimap to what it should look like.

My best guess (not having looked at the source code or how Linux's suspend works) is that the minimap is a big buffer either on the GPU or in memory that gets written to when scrolling or when the file is loaded for the first time. When the OS suspends the system, it doesn't save the value of the buffer, just its pointer. Then when it gets woken up, the buffer pointer is used (as usual) by VS Code to draw the minimap. During the downtime, the buffer gets written to by other things, and when VS Code comes back to reclaim the memory, it simply displays what's in the buffer as it always has, which is garbage now. As soon as something related changes, the buffer gets rewritten and everything works as it should.

|Overnight|A Couple Seconds|
|---|---|
|![Overnight](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21088150/27988069-8871fc5e-63d6-11e7-8f31-32db6d1d40e0.png)|![Seconds](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21088150/27988073-a8938aca-63d6-11e7-8e1a-962a5615e2b0.png)|

data.title: Inconsistent JavaScript Intellisense / not working
data.body: - VSCode Version: Version 1.13.1 - OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.5 (same on Win10) Steps to Reproduce: What I am trying to do: I am using webpack aliases and want to utilize VS Code Intellisense for them `webpack.config.js` ```js ... alias: { ... App: path.resolve(__dirname, 'ClientApp'), ... } ... ``` `ClientApp` Folder structure `jsconfig.json` ```json { "compilerOptions": { "target": "es6", "baseUrl": ".", "paths": { "App": ["./"] } }, "exclude": ["dist"] } ``` Some functions like `deleteProperty` are not recognized if using alias `App` but are recognized if using relative paths other functions are recognized (in same folder, completely same format used) additionally using `index.js` with re-exports does not work even with relative paths (`IOptions.js` has a default export object, recognized only in the last format) `import { IOptions } from 'App/models';` import { IOptions as IOptions2 } from './models'; import IOptions3 from 'App/models/IOptions'; import IOptions4 from './models/IOptions'; Are these configuration issues or?

data.title: Allow programmatically selecting a TreeItem in custom views

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I've been trying to mimick the `files.autoReveal` behavior of the regular explorer in the Dependency Explorer of the Haxe extension. I can expand the necessary nodes just fine, but I don't think there's any way to scroll to the correct position in the view + highlight the node programmatically right now.

From what I can tell, the currently planned enhancements won't help with this (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/27823). Could a function for selecting a node be added to API? I think a lot of other extensions would benefit from this as well, [Code Outline comes to mind](https://github.com/patrys/vscode-code-outline/issues/12).

data.title: Debug hover does not work in some cases
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:18:03.540Z) and 1.14.0-insiders 
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.8.0-56-generic
- Node Version: Tested on version 7 and 8
- Debugging Protocol: Inspector
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-clock|Compulim|0.0.1|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.1.1|
|vscode-simple-icons|LaurentTreguier|1.4.1|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.16|
|theme-material-neutral|bernardodsanderson|0.9.8|
|npm-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.3.0|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.4.2|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|RelativePath|jakob101|0.12.0|
|vscode-colorize|kamikillerto|0.5.1|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.6|
|vetur|octref|0.9.0|
|vscode-theme-darcula|rokoroku|1.0.13|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.4.1|;


---

Expected Behavior:

I expect to hover over the variables in line 63 (or any other line in scope), but they will show nothing:
The only thing that works with the hover in this case are the local variables in line 62 (err, results)
![vscode bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1408457/27984480-3b058e76-63d7-11e7-8e99-9e9e56756d2e.png)


Using the REPL will print out variables correctly:
![vscode shell](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1408457/27984754-d7933e54-63dd-11e7-908b-2820437247a6.png)

When debugging the same code in Chrome debugger hovering works:
![chrome-works](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1408457/27984763-03204bde-63de-11e7-8dca-d74ce4523313.png)
 
I created a repo with the [sample code](https://github.com/OfekA/vscode-debug-hover-bug)
I was trying to make it ready for you just to run, but after messing with the vscode launch options for a while I couldn't make it attach correctly, I'm sure this is something that would be simple for you.

data.title: Sometimes, Code Helper sticks around after Code exits
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:13:05.928Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions: the listing length exceeds browsers' URL characters limit
---

Steps to Reproduce: Unknown, I simply quit (normally) when a Code Helper starts smoking the CPU.

Here are the command line arguments:

```
$ pgrep -lf 'Code Helper'
28505 /Users/wmertens/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Frameworks/Code Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Code Helper /Users/wmertens/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/out/utils/electronForkStart /Users/wmertens/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js --useSingleInferredProject --enableTelemetry --cancellationPipeName /var/folders/g4/76q469c16sg48h2xcl17lm900000gn/T/vscode-tscancellation-d950e0e6639261af8c23.sock*
28515 /Users/wmertens/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Frameworks/Code Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Code Helper /Users/wmertens/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/node_modules/typescript/lib/typingsInstaller.js --globalTypingsCacheLocation /Users/wmertens/Library/Caches/typescript --enableTelemetry
90371 /Users/wmertens/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Frameworks/Code Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Code Helper /Users/wmertens/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/bootstrap --type=extensionHost
90420 /Users/wmertens/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Frameworks/Code Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Code Helper /Users/wmertens/.vscode/extensions/dbaeumer.vscode-eslint-1.2.11/node_modules/vscode-languageclient/lib/utils/electronForkStart /Users/wmertens/.vscode/extensions/dbaeumer.vscode-eslint-1.2.11/server/server.js --node-ipc
```


The high CPU one was the bootstrap one (90371), I killed it (regular kill signal) and that closed the other Helpers too.

Please provide troubleshooting steps I can perform next time this happens.

data.title: [REQUEST] Show current Symbol name (class/function) in status bar
data.body:
In navigating or reviewing long code files, I often do symbol search (cmd-shift-o on Mac) to type name of class/function and quickly jump to it. In long functions, particularly when skipping through search results, I often have to scroll up and down to see which function/class is the editor cursor is currently highlighting within.

It'd be most obvious and logical to simply show in the editor's status bar at bottom on what function and class (or simply the current symbol as VS Code calls it) is the editor cursor inside of. Before the line and column numbers are shown in the status bar currently.

Related to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/22689

data.title: Emmet places HTML tags around the last word when entering text in between HTML tags.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.31.1 - OS Version: Win 10 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Have emmet/new emmet. 2.Type within html tags, then press tab. Reproduces without extensions: Yes When trying to enter a tag quickly, say > `

words words words

` I expect the behavior to be like: > h1 -> tab -> enter contents of h1 tag -> tab to end of tag to continue writing. and you should get this. with the cursor at the end of the closing tag. > `

words words words

|` Instead I get something like this with the last word wrapped in a random tag, and the cursor and the end of the newly created tags. > `

words words |

.` Yet if I hit space at the end of the word, so that there is nothing to put inside of tags, hitting tab goes to the end of the closing tag as I want it to. The only plugin I have for the editor is "indent-rainbow" and my settings look like this: > "editor.tabSize": 2, > "editor.wordBasedSuggestions": false, > "workbench.colorTheme": "Atom One Dark", > "editor.rulers": [80,100], > "editor.wordWrap": "off", > "editor.cursorStyle": "line", > "editor.renderWhitespace": "all", > "emmet.useNewEmmet": true > Here is a video showing my issue. https://streamable.com/ofkbv I have also been able to reproduce this in Atom by installing the Emmet plugin, so it must have something to do with that, but I cannot find a setting to make it only put tags around emmet shortcuts, instead of around every word when pressing tab.

data.title: Test: Delete word before/after cursor in terminal
data.body:
Test for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/28825

Complexity: 2

- [x] Linux @kieferrm 
- [x] macOS @mjbvz 
- [x] Windows @roblourens 

Please test the following keybindings based on your OS/shell and also make sure the chosen keybinding makes sense for the OS:

- Linux
  - ctrl+backspace: Delete word before cursor
  - ctrl+delete: Delete word after cursor
  - bash
  - fish
- macOS
  - alt+backspace: Delete word before cursor
  - alt+delete: Delete word after cursor (not sure if you can test this with a regular macbook keyboard?)
  - bash
  - zsh
- Windows
  - ctrl+backspace: Delete word before cursor
  - ctrl+delete: Delete word after cursor
  - Test under cmd.exe, powershell.exe, bash.exe (WSL) - I would be surprised if all these work on windows, and if not there isn't much we can do about it AFAIK. It'd be good to know exactly what works and what doesn't for the release notes.

data.title: `code -n` should automatically open parent folder in Explorer
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:13:05.928Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.9.3|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.4.2|
|tslint|eg2|0.16.0|
|prettier-vscode|esbenp|0.21.0|
|vim|vscodevim|0.9.0|;

- Reproducible without extensions: Yes
---
When I open one or more files in the same folder, I expect the folder to be opened along with them. But right now that's not the case.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. `cd new-project`
2. `code -n package.json`
3. Toggle Explorer, click "Open Folder", and open the project folder
4. The window reloads and `package.json` is closed

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? No Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

The visual studio code editor opens very slowly. Scrolling through code lags. Cursor placement lags as well.

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.13
- OS Version: Windows 7 x64 Enterprise

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Opening Visual Studio Code
2. Compared with other text editors and only this editor has issues. Notepad, Notepad++

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes
